Gates.name: Pauli X gate
Gates.description: Pauli X gate (π rotation over X-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

Gates.name: Pauli Y gate
Gates.description: Pauli Y gate (π rotation over Y-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

Gates.name: Pauli Z gate
Gates.description: Pauli Z gate (π rotation over Z-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

Gates.name: Rotated Pauli X gate
Gates.description: RX (Rotated Pauli X gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the x-axis.

Gates.name: Rotated Pauli Y gate
Gates.description: RY (Rotated Pauli Y gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the y-axis.

Gates.name: Rotated Pauli Z gate
Gates.description: RZ (Rotated Pauli Z gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the z-axis.

Gates.name: Hadamard gate
Gates.description: One qubit rotation, mapping the two qubit- basis states to two superposition states.

Gates.name: Controlled NOT gate
Gates.description: CNOT or (Controlled Pauli-X) acts on 2 or more qubits.

Gates.name: Measurement gate
Gates.description: Used to observe the quantum state.
